CatDescriptText: Mrs. Tille Smith, housewife, Manchester and Mr. Kenneth Gamble, steelworker, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, June 2, 1962, pg. 13  with question: "What's the ideal way to spend a summer vacation?" Mrs. Smith's answer reads: "I'd like to go to the seashore and just loaf."  Mr. Gamble's answer reads: "I'd like to travel to the West Coast, around Los Angeles.  I don't care for the East Coast and would like a change of atmostphere."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Tille Smith wearing light colored blouse with smocked stripes and bracelet on right wrist, holding paper bag and eyeglasses, standing in front of ribbed metal wall; Portrait of Kenneth Gamble wearing eyeglasses and moustache, standing in front of ribbed metal wall
